content: each single_crochet sl into 1st single_crochet tie off 112 n b if you re really nitpicky like me you ll notice the color changes leave a slight dent in the edges of the stripe to fix that i used the yarn ends to embroider a v-shape to imitate the feet of a stitch before i wove in ends this pattern doesn t necessarily need blocking but i found that using a bra cup insert such as the kind found in some swimsuits and tank tops with a small amount of fabric bunched under it was the perfect size and shape for blocking for nerds my primary goal in making this pattern was to distribute the increases evenly so as to keep a circular shape and a smooth curve i eyeballed it at first but then came up with a way to diagram it to optimize placement of increases 😜 you may notice that it was quite literally a back-of-the-envelope calculation
